replies.commentBody:
Sure, Steve W., then a court trial that offers only one side of the story is a perfectly fair representation of "TRUTH" -- at least by your standards.

Shouldn't the Republicans release THEIR internal communications which, in your words, have "no legitimate reason to be kept secret"? An investigation of them would be entirely in line with your beliefs. You don't get to have it both ways.

Primaries are not federal elections. This administration should WANT to clear themselves of any shadow on their integrity in a national election. That they oppose such openness is telling.

comments.commentBody:
The "election" was not hacked. The "election" is the process of voters recording votes on ballots, often within electronic voting machines.. votes which are then counted by election officials and certified to state and federal Secretaries of State. There is absolutely no evidence, nor even any claim, that Russia interfered with the ELECTION process.

Democrats are saying "hacked the election", because they are too lazy and dishonest to say "Russian agents published the TRUE CONTENT of emails between Democratic party officials (not "government officials") which described COLLUSION between the DNC and the media (particularly CNN) to unfairly benefit the DNC candidate by providing advance copies of questions to be asked at upcoming debates. The public knowledge of this COLLUSION between the DNC and the media undermined the credibility of both groups, and THAT influenced some voters (including myself) to withdraw support for the DNC and its candidates."

There is no legitimate reason for any political party's internal communications to be kept secret - OUR Parties should not be doing anything that they would not proudly admit to anyone - the fact that it took Russian agents for the TRUTH about DNC SECRETS to be known, says more about corruption within the DNC and the "impartial" media, than it says about Putin, Russia, Trump or the RNC.

Russia was just the messenger here - "hacked the election" is an attempt to "shoot the messenger", nothing more.

replies.commentBody:
There was no Republican support whatsoever in the last administration -- the GOP already burned that bridge themselves. They offered a highly successful model of political warfare. Why are they surpirsed when the opposition learns from their example?

"Always" and "never" seldom prove accurate in forecasting human behavior. It is early days yet for this administration.

comments.commentBody:
It's always "cloak and dagger" with you counterfeits ... NMP's batteries have been drained dry and when all is said and done you are all going to have to face 2 very solemn facts. The first - you will have totally burnt all ties to spurring republican support whatsoever; from this point on into a very dark future for the democratic party. The second - when all your little masquerading is over - you will have lost at least 1/4 of your conglomerates to the right - and still have to face a lost battle; an embarrassment; and most likely more damages and destruction in the news from your "hard left" side - because that is all you folks do in times of failure and prostration.

Believe me - if there is one thing for certain in this election; democrats are doomed to ever recoup from the hate and disgust seen throughout this land.

He is such a good, thorough, thoughtful man who did his best under incredibly difficult circumstances.
He is very much admired in my country and the rest of Europe.
Its very touching that a French petition has been started to have him as French President.
Its already picked up another 5000 votes since yesterday, so its nearly at 46,000
http://obama2017.fr/
So sweet. But we want him in the UK desperately, perhaps he can be cloned.
Im currently in Australia and they love him here, he has somethig like an 80% approval rating, and Australians are not traditionally fond of US Presidents.

replies.commentBody: Wow, you're right. It's almost an artificially created mob, with only a fraction of the participants real people, but those real people are especially energized because they think they're part of a mob.

comments.commentBody:
I notice a cadence to comments on articles, especially those about Russia. The first group of comments are more likely anti-Trump without a lot of back and forth. More left leaning. They are probably from subscribers. After about a half hour to hour, a new type of comment comes in. These seem paid for. They only use insults and they are blatantly planting questions about the content of the article. The names and people are often Russian. Many are not hiding they are in Moscow. People start getting involved in a back and forth on commenting. Then comes a sustained stream of comments from the right. None of them mention facts. They are the insult comments: 'babies', 'get over it', 'no one cares about this'. Ok, I've worked in design and marketing a long time. If I were to design a bot or pay a center to respond to articles, this is very much how it would unfold.
College interns are building ways to detect and block fake comments. Might the New York Times hire someone or a team to test these hypothesis and build responses? I would kickstart that. Our democracy depends on authentic communication.

replies.commentBody: You must be joking? Ansitting Senator has two brief comtacts with the Russian ambassador and you want a constitutional crisis? You liberals are definitely off your meds. Answer this genius, why does Russia have an ambassador? Why is there an embassy? Is it not appropriate for American Senators to have talks with Russian officials? Didn't John McCain just go to Syria? Didn't he just talk with the Australian leader? Didn't Schumer meet with Putin? How about when Israel's prime minister gave a speech to the congress? Do you think he talked with a few elected leaders? You liberals are all in an uproar over nothing. Maybe you should rethink that meeting between Attorney General Lynch and Private citizen Bill Clinton who's wife was under investigation. Does that ring any bells?

Maybe you should have a friend or family member read these things before you hit ''submit.'' We don't declare states of emergency at the national level.

We also don't have any procedure to follow even if we found out that Mr. Obama was actually born in Kenya, or if Sessions turned out to be one of the THIRTY Senators who spoke with the Russians just about the Iranian nuclear energy deal.
Had we found out about the rape of Johanna Broadrick in October 1992, should that vote have been delayed?
replies.userLocation: Fair Verona where we lay our scene

replies.commentBody: Lol! Seems more and more obvious that Trump is being attacked by the Deep State, a treasonous soft coupt.

comments.commentBody: It seems more and more obvious to me that President Obama should have taken  more aggressive steps before the election; declaring a state of emergency and delaying the election until the intelligence agencies could report would have been more appropriate than letting a tainted election proceed.

replies.commentBody:
"The truth will set us free"? Do you mean "the true content of DNC party emails"? Because Russia only did what the New York Times SHOULD be doing - reporting the truth about collusion between DNC and CNN on an attempt to cheat in a Presidential debate.

If Trump was as incompetent and unqualified as you say he is, then why did the DNC feel it was necessary to cheat? If the "hacked emails" had shown that Party officials had REFUSED an offer to cheat, and instead insisted that the offer and refusal must be reported publicly... THOSE "hacked emails" - those facts - would have motivated me to support the DNC and its candidate.
I'm not sure Putin is entirely thrilled with the merchandise he bought.   Its packaging and marketing looked a lot better than what was actually in the box.

comments.commentBody: Putin must be relishing with delight his foresight and skill in cultivating and later abetting an incompetent American presidential candidate who's election has destabilized our government and our (until recently) much-admired way of life.  The craven opportunism of the GOP (when do I get my school voucher?) in whitewashing what is obviously a national security scandal is reprehensible.  The truth will set us free indeed.

replies.commentBody: Let's have an investigation! But let's also have some ability to be fair. Jeff Sessions was a sitting Senator. Of course he talked with a number of foreign officials. This is much to do about nothing.

"For all those Trump supporters who don't want a full and independent investigation, why not?"
The short answer is a politically motivated investigation not based on probably cause would distract the Administration from serving the country, and expose private information to likely criminal leakers . Illegally leaks and probably illegally collected surveillance including phone taps have shown no wrongdoing. Also investigation can look into an issue A and expand into issues B & C.

I personally don't think there was any collusion. In our country, we have Fourth Amendment principals of not invading privacy without first having probable cause, and oath of affirmation, and a very specific judge issued warrant. I expect the Trumps administrations opposition would love to put the Administration on the defensive whether or not there was legitimate reason to investigate, knowing criminal leaking would occur, and the Administration would spend much of its time that could be spent on serving America, defending itself.

There is a great deal of information we keep private that has nothing to do with wrongdoing. For example, we have classified information. A desire for privacy does not imply wrongdoing. People who use password protect information like medical records, shred their private documents, or expect their phone calls to be private generally do not do so to hide wrong going.

By the way, are a likely false narrative and criminal leaking to support it a great wrong?

Getbendt, if Jeff Sessions was just "doing his job," why did he lie about it twice at his confirmation hearing? The contact itself does not signal chicanery, but his lying about it sure does.

No one gave Clinton the benefit of the doubt on ANYTHING even when no evidence of wrongdoing was ever found -- why should we give it to Jeff Sessions on faith? Because he's Republican? Because he's male? Because his last name isn't Clinton? I like rules to apply to everyone, regardless of party, gender or identity.

comments.commentBody: For all those Trump supporters who don't want a full and independent investigation, why not? If this all false, then people need to be held accountable for their deeds. I am good if that is what is determined. Accountability for all.

Upon reflection, President Obama was in a difficult position when presidential campaigning by Trump and Clinton was in full swing last summer, and it first became apparent something was going on with the Russians interfering with the election. Had he chosen to release all information before fully vetting it, the Republicans would have cried foul, that the President was showing partisanship by doing so, and there had to be consideration for how voters would react. Further, from all the polls, it seemed Clinton would win without a problem. When Comey pulled his October surprise, it was then too late. When the election results were known, there was a scramble to secure all types of information, including the intelligence on the Russian hacking.
I do not fault the President for his actions, it was a "damned if you do, and damned if you don't situation".

replies.commentBody: While I agree that whispers are not proof of a plan, the facts support a thorough investigation. There is no certainty that there will be a thorough investigation, as there is a clear effort on the platt of senior Republicans to block a proper independent investigation. The most outrageous thing is the hypocrisy!!! Can you imagine what these craven hacks would be screaming if this was Obama or  Clinton. No when the shoe is on the other foot it is all "let's see facts before we sling accusations" they have no problem spreading lies and falsehoods when they want to smear the Democrats, but now they are the soul of discretion!!! Liars, hypocrites and cowards!!! Does their perfidy know no bounds!!!! Truly shameful!

comments.commentBody: The truth is that they are all chasing ghosts.  A "connection" implies a plan.  Any diplomatic conversations were just that, conversations.  Show us the absolute proof that the Trump Team is dirty, and we can act on it objectively.  Continuing on with this "whisper" campaign without facts is detrimental to us all.

replies.commentBody: Unfortunately, it's not true...they're a lot of misleading assumptions here. It's sort of like watching Homeland, reading these articles. Good for fantasy.

And if it's all false or blown out of proportion? Then what? Obamas team of liars and scoundrels are subverting the new President. It's in his playbook. In my opinion, Obama wanted Hillary to lose and Trumpnto win. He gets rid of the Clinton dynasty, stays on top of the party and gets to take pot shots at the new president. Trump should fire everyone in the government who is connected to these leaks tonight. Can them all.

Imagine that the NY Time creating a story that make Obama look like a hero... Unfortunately what is true, is that we now know how "purchased" by liberal ideals and directly major media was...So odds are likely this is fake news

comments.commentBody: If this story is true, then those Obama appointees and functionaries are heroes and patriots.

replies.commentBody: Do you have any clue whatsoever about what you are saying? Just how did the Russians make a single American voter change their mind? How did the Russians or Trump keep her from going to Wisconsin? Or Michigan? How did the Russians or Trump get her to set up a secret email server and then allow it to be hacked? Did the Russians put Bill on that plane with the former attorney general? Did the Russians force Clinton to call us deplorable? Did the Russians put us 20 trillion in debt and cause the unemployment of millions because of liberal policies? Just how did the Russians get all those losers to protest across America and thereby caused millions to vote for Trump? How did the Russians get twice as many blacks to vote for Trump than voted for Romney? How did the Russians get into every county and its polling booths? I know five people who never voted in their lives who registered and voted for Trump because they are sick and tired of liberal lies, not because the Russians made them do it. The democrats have lost thousands of elective offices over the last eight years because of their policies. Not because of Russian interference. Fox News is proving through its ratings and huge dominance over the media that Americans are fed up with progressive lies. You lost!

comments.commentBody:
Were it Hillary Clinton who was having pre-election contact with the Russians, Sessions, et al. would have already convened the impeachment trial. So let's not pretend that this is a case of there being no there there.

I have the advantage of having heard Sessions recuse himself. I waited for him to say he had appointed a special prosecutor. I never heard it because he did not do it.

It's about time someone investigated the Republicans. How many years have the rest of us put up with listening to their tired assertions that Hillary is a crook whom Donald needs to "lock up." What's good for the goose is good for gander, afterall.

It is past time to investigate the interference with a US election, no matter what side benefitted. Had Hillary Clinton won the Electoral College as well as the popular vote, the investigation would be on already with Republicans trying to figure out a way to make her take the fall.

Since Darrell Issa says he wants to investigate this matter, do you suppose he'll slip and call a trumper, "Secretary Clinton?" Afterall, he has made a career of investigating Mrs. Clinton.

replies.commentBody: Are you a communist? It seams your solution is tied to what the Russians have been doing for about a century.  You are a sick individual.

Angry though we may be, we've gotta do what they haven't done, which is to abide by our laws. While treason is a hanging offense for sure, we can't go all mob on them. comments.commentBody: I am not a democrat. I do insist that all people tied to *45 in any way should be investigated for treason. If even the smallest question about their loyalty to the USA, not *45 exists, they should be tried in open court. Defended by privately funded lawyers & suspended from any jobs they have with either the regime of *45 or any of his companies. Anyone found guilty should hang, in public. As soon as the IMPEACHMENT of *45 has concluded, the trial from that impeachment is concluded, the sentencing of *45 and all of his staffers, cabinet, & all congressmen who have had any contact with this illegal regime have been investigated. All sentences to take place together on the Mall, with all family members required to be there, & sign documents that they agree with the sentences. Or they lose all benefits any of them may ever qualify for. All assets of all those found guilty (including all of *45's companies) will be turned over to the Treasury for sale & putting the resultant funds into the general fund to pay Federal bills. The families will be required to turn over any assets given or sold to them by any of the guilty after Jan 2015. They must never be trusted. They lie like they breathe, compulsively. That is why hanging is such an appropriate sentence. Of course any of them can resign now & confess to the select committee for these crimes, taking polygraphs, giving all information on *45 & his crooks to them, for trial. They will not be charged. I want the traitors to hang.

replies.commentBody: How can we know there is no substance. It beggars belief!! Surely even you can understand why this needs to be investigated! How can we know what went on if we don't look at this fully. I can see by your careful bracketing of the Obama/Medvedev transcript that your suspicions of treason are one way street. We don't know what these people were up to, so there needs to be an investigation. I suspect if they were without guilt they wouldn't be lying about the contacts they did have. I also suspect that no end of reasonable arguments will penetrate your certainty.

comments.commentBody:
There's no substance to any of the breathless charges being hurled and implied. There isn't one person who can read the NYT article and say what the substance is. There is no 'news' in the article. Who said what to whom, when and where. You'll read that article from here to eternity and not have an answer to that most basic journalistic series of inquiries. But here's something that was caught on tape in a discussion with a Russian, recorded on audio and visual:

Mr Obama says: "On all these issues, but particularly missile defence, this, this can be solved but it's important for him to give me space."
Mr Medvedev replies: "Yeah, I understand. I understand your message about space. Space for you …"
Mr Obama retorts: "This is my last election. After my election I have more flexibility."
And Mr Medvedev finishes: "I understand. I will transmit this information to Vladimir [Putin]."

If anyone here or at the NYT wants to talk about treason, let's start right there.

replies.commentBody: How can we know there is no substance. It beggars belief!! Surely even you can understand why this needs to be investigated! How can we know what went on if we don't look at this fully. Yes, absolutely the terrible 'main stream media' clearly have control of the UK and Dutch governments, forcing them to confirm Trump associates meeting with Russian government officials. If the 'main stream' media you deplore were so powerful, surely they could convince all the Fox watching and Rush listening delusionals to believe there false stories. It is truly incredible to watch the slow turning of the right wing minds! Finally hoisted by their own pittards! We don't know what these people were up to, so there needs to be an investigation. I suspect if they were without guilt they wouldn't be lying about the contacts they did have. I also suspect that no end of reasonable arguments will penetrate your certainty. Suddenly you don't like innuendo and smears!!! The Republicans undermined and hamstrung 2 presidencies with theses tactics! As they say, 'now the worm turns!' Enjoy!!!

comments.commentBody: This is clearly an attempt by the Dems and liberal media to manufacture a crisis where none exists. As many Comments have pointed out, if there was any real substance here the information would have been leaked directly to the media or public and not scattered among various agencies as the NYT wants to believe. Makes no sense whatsoever. What is most troubling is the ongoing onslaught of rumors, innuendos, fake news and manufactured crises being postured by an angry, hateful media all in an attempt to dominate and control the agenda of the new Trump Administration.

Random thoughts...

Ivanka knows a lot. Her nonverbal communication suggests so. Turns more and more flat.

No matter how much we may despise Trump, as I do, the stock market shows optimism and confidence. As long as people are content with their wealth, I don't expect values, like truthfulness, to count. Nixon did not have a very healthy economical context.

Hooray for the press and the print media. Would love to know the behind the scenes process.

President Obama passionately warned us that DJT was unfit to run our country. Yet the electoral college turned a deaf ear choosing deviousness, let-me-entertain-you and I-can-get-by-with-anything including Putin as a BFF over sanity and substance.

replies.commentBody: Should we use the McConnell approach?

The Russians interfered in Brexit aided by Robert Mercer, your behind the scenes conniving Billonaire.
Ditto France and Holland.
Why, to break up the EU so Putin can do what he likes.
Dont be so blind and naive.

JK -
Still - to this DAY - there is NO evidence that Russians received any information they shouldn't have or altered any election counts.
People have been hacking emails for decades, and the Russians probably aren't as good sat it as our Asian ''friends.''

There is evidence of a large nation basically declaring war on the electronic systems throughout th United States, but that country is Red China.

comments.commentBody: The liberal left are clutching at straws on this made up Russia story.  How many Democrats had contact with Russians during the campaign?  Crickets...  Why not just act like grown ups and admit defeat and move on?  It's time to do what is right for the Country and not what you believe to be right for your party.  Remember, this is the same Russia that Obama said he was going to have more flexibility with after he got reelected and the same Russia that Hillary claimed a reset with.  Seems a bit hypocritical of the Democrat party to all of a sudden cry foul.

replies.commentBody: Well that is what a full investigation is designed to determine. Let it be done.

An investigation is undertaken when there is evidence that a crime has been committed. In this case, there is none.
The FBI has said that repeatedly. Obama said that - at least until Clinton lost the election and the Democrats began seeking excuses. To date, all there has been is finger-pointing and innuendo.
The other reason some want "investigations" is as fishing expeditions. Open questioning, especially on TV, provides an opportunity for grandstanding, making defamatory statements, and wasting time and taxpayer money.

comments.commentBody: Democrats with their hair on fire! Guess what -there's no "there" there.

replies.commentBody: Do the people who keep using the term "fake news stories" and "fake news media" realize that they sound delusional?  CNN is a real news outlet.  Just because you don't agree with what they say doesn't make them imaginary.  It is fascinating to see what people are willing to believe, simply because they want to identify with the "winning" president.  It's like finding out your favorite athlete used steroids to win and insisting he competed fairly.  It's just not accurate, whoever's side you're on.

comments.commentBody:
With all of these so-called contacts between Russian diplomats and people somehow associated with the Trump campaign, how did the Trump campaign cause the Clinton campaign to supply their email password to wikileaks could expose CNN and other fake news media were allowing the Clinton campaign to review and edit their fake news stories? Or, the CNN was allowing the Clinton campaign to see debate questions? How does revealing the true inner workings of the Clinton campaign, because the Clinton campaign gave a hacker it's email password, prove the Trump campaign was working with the Russians? And, if Russia hacked the election system, why did Russia allow Clinton to win the popular vote?

All of this fake news supplied by Obama to damage the next president, doesn't pass the "smell test!"

Sessions doesn't want to be convicted of treason, so he is getting out before the noose tightens around his neck. The rest of the treacherous Trump admin and GOP congressmen who are helping cover up the treasonous acts will not be so lucky. The question is: will they all be hung together or one by one?
